class_notes:
This class investigates contemporary curatorial practice through total immersion in art and exhibition history. Classes and workshops will have students contemplate curation for solo or group exhibits, work in teams, and gain professional practice. They lay the groundwork for the conception and production of exhibitions. The classes will address practical matters such as space, duration, audience, and programmatic partners for an exhibition. You will grow your visual vocabulary. The students will also engage in the development and production of professional support materials. 
This class is a part of the Integrated Visual Arts Co-Major (IVAC) curriculum and does not count towards the Art History major, minor, or concentrations.


Location:  Visual Arts Building 147 (Gallery)
course_description: This class investigates contemporary curatorial practice through total immersion in art and exhibition history. Classes will be structured around the discussion of a compendium of contemporary art texts, show catalogs, reviews, and curatorial statements.
sections: Class Nbr: 3782, Section #: 1, Type: ART, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 1-4:30p, Instructor: D. Fuller, Status: Open
